title: Laughing driver deliberately crashes into random car on road in east London and sends it spinning
text:
This is the shocking moment a driver deliberately rammed into another car on a dual carriageway in east London, sending it spinning.

The driver and his passenger both laughed as they closed in on the other vehicle, at the A13 near Beckton, Newham in the capital.

It seems as if the driver randomly decided to target the other car, a Toyota, and he rammed into its back on the left side.

The impact made the Toyota spin out of control, away from the middle lane.

As the car and its driver reeled in shock at the unexpected collision, the offending vehicle sped off, its occupants laughing out loud.

The collision took place late at night, with the victim managing to stay away from any other cars in the road after being sent spinning.

The shocking video was uploaded to Twitter by user Hear The Truth, who said: 'What are the police doing about this?'

They seem to have targeted the car, a Toyota, at random and drive towards it while laughing

The car crashes into the Toyota, sending it spinning, before the driver and his passenger speed away

The shocking collision took place on a dual carriageway, though it is unclear when it happened

It is unclear when exactly the video was filmed.

The Metropolitan Police told Mail Online that the footage had not been reported to them.

A spokesman said: 'We recommend the footage be reported to police via @MetCC or via the online portal https://www.met.police.uk/dashcam.'
description: The driver and his passenger both laughed as they closed in on the other vehicle and crashed into it, at the A13 near Beckton, Newham in London.
